docs.abstract: Carry on, but don’t keep calm: this is big.
docs.snippet: Carry on, but don’t keep calm: this is big.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House said on Tuesday that more than 7 million people had signed up for healthcare coverage under the Affordable Care Act, exceeding its original goal after a botched rollout of the program.

headline.main: White House: Obamacare Enrollment Exceeds Seven Million People
headline.print_headline: White House: Obamacare Enrollment Exceeds Seven Million People

docs.snippet: The White House said on Tuesday that more than 7 million people had signed up for healthcare coverage under the Affordable Care Act, exceeding its original goal after a botched rollout of the program.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Representative Paul Ryan, the leading Republican voice on budget policy, rolled out a fiscal blueprint on Tuesday that calls for deep cuts in domestic programs, increased defense spending and a goal of erasing annual deficits within a decade.

headline.main: Republican Ryan's Budget Sets Political Course for Party in 2014
headline.print_headline: Republican Ryan's Budget Sets Political Course for Party in 2014

docs.snippet: U.S. Representative Paul Ryan, the leading Republican voice on budget policy, rolled out a fiscal blueprint on Tuesday that calls for deep cuts in domestic programs, increased defense spending and a goal of erasing annual deficits within a decade.

docs.lead_paragraph: House Budget Committee Chairman Paul Ryan unveiled an updated Republican budget plan Tuesday that would slash $5.1 trillion in federal spending over coming decade and promises to balance the government's books with wide-ranging cuts in programs like food stamps and government-paid health care for the poor and working class.

headline.main: Ryan Unveils House GOP Budget Claiming Balance
headline.print_headline: Ryan Unveils House GOP Budget Claiming Balance

docs.snippet: House Budget Committee Chairman Paul Ryan unveiled an updated Republican budget plan Tuesday that would slash $5.1 trillion in federal spending over coming decade and promises to balance the government's books with wide-ranging cuts in programs like...

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's national healthcare program signed up more than 7 million people by the end of March, the president said on Tuesday, notching a rare victory after a months-long, glitch-filled rollout of the law.

headline.main: Obamacare Enrollment Exceeds Seven Million Target Despite Setback
headline.print_headline: Obamacare Enrollment Exceeds Seven Million Target Despite Setback

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama's national healthcare program signed up more than 7 million people by the end of March, the president said on Tuesday, notching a rare victory after a months-long, glitch-filled rollout of the law.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House said on Monday that it expects final enrollment numbers for private health care insurance under Obamacare in 2014 to be "substantially larger" than 6 million after a busy final weekend of in-person and online signups.

headline.main: White House Sees Obamacare Sign-Ups 'Substantially Larger' Than Six Million
headline.print_headline: White House Sees Obamacare Sign-Ups 'Substantially Larger' Than Six Million

docs.snippet: The White House said on Monday that it expects final enrollment numbers for private health care insurance under Obamacare in 2014 to be "substantially larger" than 6 million after a busy final weekend of in-person and online signups.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. administration said key segments of its Obamacare website, HealthCare.gov, were unavailable to new users for a second time on Monday, as record numbers of people tried to access the site hours before the enrollment deadline for health insurance.

headline.main: U.S. Says HealthCare.gov Functions Unavailable to New Users
headline.print_headline: U.S. Says HealthCare.gov Functions Unavailable to New Users

docs.snippet: The U.S. administration said key segments of its Obamacare website, HealthCare.gov, were unavailable to new users for a second time on Monday, as record numbers of people tried to access the site hours before the enrollment deadline for health...

docs.lead_paragraph: Like so much about the government's health care overhaul, Monday's deadline to sign up for coverage in 2014 didn't turn out quite as planned: Many people still are eligible for extensions that will let them enroll.

headline.main: Q&A: Status Update as Health Law Marks a Milestone
headline.print_headline: Q&A: Status Update as Health Law Marks a Milestone

docs.snippet: Like so much about the government's health care overhaul, Monday's deadline to sign up for coverage in 2014 didn't turn out quite as planned: Many people still are eligible for extensions that will let them enroll.

docs.lead_paragraph: A blizzard, jammed phone lines and unreliable websites failed to stop throngs of procrastinating Americans from trying to sign up for health coverage by the midnight Monday deadline for President Barack Obama's signature domestic policy initiative.

headline.main: Deadline Brings High Interest for Health Insurance
headline.print_headline: Deadline Brings High Interest for Health Insurance

docs.snippet: A blizzard, jammed phone lines and unreliable websites failed to stop throngs of procrastinating Americans from trying to sign up for health coverage by the midnight Monday deadline for President Barack Obama's signature domestic policy initiative.

docs.lead_paragraph: Also on the Minute, open enrollment for health care ends and a look at a gun law that may affect restaurant business.

headline.main: Times Minute | A Surfing Innovator Dies

docs.snippet: Also on the Minute, open enrollment for health care ends and a look at a gun law that may affect restaurant business.
